0: AN ACT REQUIRING PARENTS TO PLANT TWO TREES FOR EVERY CHILD BORN TO THEM, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES
mother-bill statusstatus: Approved by the House on 2019-01-14, transmitted to the Senate on 2019-01-15 and received by the Senate on 2019-01-15 Substituted by HB08727
history:
House Bill/Resolution NO. HB00536
FULL TITLE : AN ACT REQUIRING PARENTS TO PLANT TWO TREES FOR EVERY CHILD BORN TO THEM, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES
SHORT TITLE : Family Tree Planting Act Of 2016
ABSTRACT : Requires the planting of two (2) trees for every child born of a couple, one (1) tree for the father and another tree for the mother.
PRINCIPAL AUTHOR/S : OLIVAREZ, ERIC L.
DATE FILED : 2016-06-30
SIGNIFICANCE: NATIONAL
NATURE : Economic
ACTIONS TAKEN BY THE COMMITTEE
COMMITEE HEARINGS/ACTIONS:
      1. Scheduled for meeting/hearing on 2018-10-08
      2. Approved by the Committee on Appropriations on 2018-10-08
          -Unnumbered Substitute Bill to House Bills Numbered 536, 3446, 3632, 4430 and 5549 was approved with amendment.
MOTHER BILL: HB08727
ACTIONS TAKEN BY THE COMMITTEE ON RULES
REFERRAL TO THE COMMITTEE ON REFORESTATION ON 2016-07-27
